newsitem.title: GERMANY: PWA sells unit to Munksjo.
newsitem.headline: PWA sells unit to Munksjo.

text.p: German paper manufacturer PWA Papierwerke Waldhof-Aschaffenburg AG said on Monday it would sell its subsidiary PWA Dekor GmbH to Sweden's Munksjo AB for about 160 million marks.

PWA Dekor, which makes decorative paper used in furniture production, has three plants in Germany, Spain and the U.S. It generated sales of just over 320 million marks in 1995, PWA, a unit of Sweden's Svenska Cellulosa Aktiebolaget SCA said in a statement.
The purchase price amounted to 10.5 times PWA Dekor's 1995 pre-tax profit, PWA said. PWA Dekor employs some 640 people.
"The sale is part of the SCA and PWA group's strategy to concentrate on core activities," PWA said. The transaction will take backdated effect from September 30.
PWA and Munksjo have agreed the sale but it has yet to be approved by PWA's supervisory board.
The sale is the latest in a series of spin-offs of non-core businesses at PWA since it was taken over by SCA at the start of 1995.
